page.title: 08Houses in Sebergham
page.content: The majority of houses are now owner occupied. Very few houses have been built within the past eighty years. A disused quarry provided stone for some houses whilst many were built from cobbles out of the river. Roofs are of either Westmorland slate or concrete tiles. The Victorian Rectory standing on an eminence facing SW and overlooking the river is brick built and very sub- stantial. The house had been run down whilst in the ownership of the church but was sold into private hands in 1976. Extensive alterations have been made in the past two years enlarging the stables and adding two extensions to the house itself to give greater family accommodation and comfort. These extensions are of brick or concrete block construction with cavity walls.
